qas.question: The Allies took back their offer to Napoleon in what month?
In what year did Napoleon attempt to resume peace talks?
Which peace initiative did Napoleon refer to when he attempted to make peace in 1814?
The new Allied demands for peace insisted France return to its boundaries of what year?
In the new Allied peace proposal, what territory would France have been forced to surrender?

context: Napoleon, expecting to win the war, delayed too long and lost this opportunity; by <a0_0>December<a0_0/> the Allies had withdrawn the offer. When his back was to the wall in <a1_0>1814<a1_0/> he tried to reopen peace negotiations on the basis of accepting <a2_0>the Frankfurt proposals<a2_0/>. The Allies now had new, harsher terms that included the retreat of France to its <a3_0>1791<a3_0/> boundaries, which meant the loss of <a4_0>Belgium<a4_0/>. Napoleon would remain Emperor, however he rejected the term. The British wanted Napoleon permanently removed; they prevailed. Napoleon adamantly refused.
